Posts.Content: megd893 wrote: My mother was told she had a lump in her left breast and after many many nerve wracking tests, they have decided to take it out.  She is going in to have a lumpectomy done on Friday but Im not really sure what to do or how to help.  How long does it take to get test results?  We dont know if its cancerous or not, but I also don't know how long we're going to have to wait for some answers... Is there anything you can reccomend I could do for her?? I've been reading as much as I can, and have taken note to take a blanket from home (in case she's cold for the trip home), and a sports bra that clasps (a little bigger than her regular ones)... Posts.Content: Nov 29, 2007 07:30PM megd893 wrote: Thank you all, so very very much.  Im on the phone with my mother as Im reading these things and it seems to be calming her down knowing other people have gone through these things.  She's not very tech saavy but just having all of your suggestions is making it easier for me to prepare (and to counter some of her concerns).  Im going back home (where she is) tonight, so we'll see how she's doing.  She's having her wire insertion done in about an hour today.  She's nervous but sounds like shes ready.  She has some questions to ask the clinic when she gets there which I think will help with everything tomorrow.  Im home for the next three days with her so Im ready to do what I need to to make her feel better. I do have one other question though... she was told that the procedure tomorrow, the removal of the lump, is going to take 3 hours.  It seems so long!  Is this something any of you faced?  Were yours this long?  Is it the norm/necessary??

Posts.Content: Dec 3, 2007 06:30PM megd893 wrote: well... it's monday... and nothing happened. I got a frantic call from my mom on Thursday after her appointment.  Apparently when they did the ultrasound to locate the lump (to do the wire insertion) they couldnt find it! It wasn't where it was last week.  They're now thinking its moved into her upper chest instead of near her armpit.  Because they couldnt locate it, they sent her home without the wire and said the surgeon/doctor would be intouch that evening with some info.  We never heard from him, and when we followed up on Friday morning, we still didnt speak to him. Finally at about 10:15am we spoke to his assistant who informed us the surgery had been cancelled (she was to have the surgery at noon).  No information, no nothing.  It was just cancelled.  Something about not wanting to do exploritory surgery when he didnt know where the lump was.  She now has an appointment with him tomorrow morning.  So we wait.
